section.title: Security Features Overview
section.para: Enterprises need protection against security breaches, insider threats, and operational issues that increases the risk of losing sensitive data. By combining technologies from both OpenStack services and HPE Security â€“ Data Security products, provides capabilities that help you to protect your data at rest and in transit, enable centralized key management, and achieve compliance with PCI-DSS.

In , a number of security enhancements are available to strengthen and harden your cloud deployment. Below is an overview of some of the features and a brief description. Follow the links to the relevant topics for instructions on setup, configuration, and use of these security features.

formalpara.title: Role-based access control (RBAC) support for Neutron networks

section.bridgehead: Data in transit protection via configurable TLS for internal API endpoints
section.para: With , data transmission between internal API endpoints is encrypted using TLS v 1.2 to protect sensitive data against unauthorized disclosure and modification (spoofing and tampering attacks). Additionally, you can configure TLS using your own certificates, from a Certificate Authority of your choice, providing deployment flexibility.
section.bridgehead: Data at rest protection using project-based encryption
section.para: You can encrypt sensitive data-at-rest on per tenant or project basis, while storing and managing keys externally and centrally using HPE ESKM. This capability requires the OpenStack Barbican API and OASIS KMIP (Key Management Interoperability Protocol) plug-ins for integration and supports encryption of Cinder block storage with .
